intro: Anechites lappulaceus, commonly known as yellow goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by dry, three-lobed seed pods. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies, roadsides, and waste areas. Anechites lappulaceus is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing food for various insects and wildlife.
